message: Further I have found http://WatchMouse.com/ , but it seems to old to run on my system. Last update is from 2008. And I have found Uptime Overlord ( http://homepage.ntlworld.com/colman_ranch/uptime/downloads.html ), but can't get it to work..

@ericflo Thanks, something like that would be perfect. The only thing is that it checks every 5 minutes, and I'd like to check every minute (my host seems to be down sporadically for a few minutes a couple of times every day, I'd like to verify when it occures :)).
http://www.pingdom.com/ can be set to work every minute
Hello everyone. I'm looking for a free tool to monitor about 5 websites every minute. Any suggestions? Tools that are not free are welcome too :)
I use monit. but you'll need more than cpanel access to setup / configure

Thanks for the suggestions! I'm trying out pingdom at the moment, it allows just one site on the free account, but does check every minute. I've looked at Monit as well, but it seems a little bit too complicated and/or extensive for the moment.
Ganglia (http://ganglia.sourceforge.net/) & Nagios (http://www.nagios.org/) are both pretty good, but they're daemons you run on the node - you'll need ssh access to setup.

Simon by Dejal (http://dejal.com/simon/) has worked nicely for me. It's software, not a web based service. Also not free. I wasn't able to find anything free that did all I wanted. Simon has tiered pricing... the $50 version will can have up to 15 active tests running.
try monitis.com or the free version mon.itor.us
